result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher James Voigt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:09 AM Defendant Christopher James Voigt in court with attorney Christian J Ness appears by zoom.  Defendant Christopher James Voigt in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by zoom for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.  Court reviews, DEF completed the plea/questionnaire via telephone with Attny.   Court indicates DEF has right to have attny appear in person, DEF agrees to proceed with Attny by video.   State recites agreement, All parties agree.   Court reviews the information, DEF enters Guilty plea to Count 1.    DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court accepts plea to Count 1, and finds DEF guilty.   Count 2 is dismissed and read in.   Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.   State makes statement prior to sentencing.  Attny Ness makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF makes statement.  Court to follow agreement.  

COURT:  160 days County jail.  Good time and huber.  100 days jail credit.    Fine/costs  $579.00    DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attny Ness request to be set for plea/sentence.   Court reset.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
